reviews.review_msg: I really enjoyed this class. The midterm was open book, but I found it more difficult than the final exam. The assignments were fair. Attendance was mandatory. I'd definitely take another class with this prof. Super nice, easy going, and a good teacher.

Rather disappointed because the final was beyond anything that had been expected, even though I studied hard for it. The midterm was open-book and I think the grades must have been low because the final was closed and the questions asked were bizarre; terms that hadn't been used, questions that required the films to be viewed far more than once.

Blair is one of my favourite profs to date. He has a humourous, casual style of lecturing that keeps most of the class engaged and interested. He shows a great selection of films and introduces a lot of ideas I never knew prior to taking the class. I wish he taught more classes, or I could take this class again.
If you go into this class not knowing anything about film, be prepared to be overwhelmed.  It's a lot of work for a beginner, but certainly do-able.  And quite interesting as well.

Blair has a way of speaking - he puts an emphasis on weird words - kind of like Chandler from Friends, and it gets really annoying and hard to listen to during his lectures. Also, he doesn't seem to really care what we think about the films. Instead he seems to be saying, "this film is good because ____" as though a viewer's opinion is unimportant.

boo-urns.  high hopes for this class.  but if you aren't a film buff then be prepared to become overwhelmed.  and blair's chill teaching style makes it slightly difficult for people who aren't planning to become the next stanley kubrick.  over all...meh.  good experience, but completely replaceable.

Blair is not yet ready to teach. He's a kid who tries to act like an adult & perhaps if he was just himself he'd teach much better. Instead he shows off, is ultra-formal and his class is really not for people who already have knowledge or ideas about films. I have lectured about film in the past at ivy league schools, so I KNOW it inside out... B-

Information presented often not accurate. He does care about film, but not ready to teach. Opinions cloud his "facts". Films far to safe. Not as knowledgeable as he would like his students to think he is, but he is a fair marker.Papers too rooted in formal qualities. Be careful if you already have background knowledge in film and its history.

who wrote the entry before mine? Blair's arch nemesis!? Please...I'd like to see that person teach a class better. Blair is a fair, kind and knowledgable instructor with a real passion for what he is doing. He makes class fun and inspires us to learn more. If you have a chance to take a class with him, do it without hesitation!

Blair is amazing professor with a great sense of humour. Pay attention in class...it's not just a course where you can slack. A few students were surprised at how many assignments we had and how challenging they were. HOWEVER...listen, put in hard work and Blair is always there to help. He rocks!
great prof, i had  him for two semesters and it was a very fun class. He is very funny and very helpful. Would recommend this class to anyone.

yes blair is an awesome prof who knows his stuff! went in to fpa 137 knowing nothing about film and came out learning so much. LOVED IT! by far best course at sfu :) but the only bad thing.......... he does have a girlfriend. boo. hahaha..jk. TAKE BLAIRS CLASS!
BLAIR IS SO HOT RIGHT NOW.... SO HOT
Really good proff he knows his stuff.His classes are well structured and imformative. He is really approachable and always willing to help. He has a great personality and is also a cuttie:)

Love Pavsek! His lectures were clear and to the point while also relating to both the textbook and film screenings. I felt like I actually learned in this class, instead of just getting credit. Plus his anecdotes are interesting and funny.

Chris is a hilarious professor in a very sarcastic way! His classes are very fun! We view a film nearly every week! Make sure you attend the classes, and take notes, since most of the midterm/final questions are from there! Do read the canvas readings, (they will be on the exam). We also had two 3 to 4 pages papers to write, so start early! Enjoy!

Almost every class we would watch a movie. Class not mandatory but if you miss one it's hard to catch up because there are no recordings. A great beginners course to film or arts in general. Really kind. I was only on the waiting list for this course until I talked to Chris and he personally helped me get in. Textbook readings not mandatory at all.

Chris is an awesome prof who always kept even the most confusing concepts in film history easy to understand. I loved how he was always upbeat, never alienated anyone, and tests were all super fair. Plus he's pretty easy on the eyes.

Unlike most profs, he's very clear in lectures. Pretty funny guy, makes things interesting. However WAY too much reading. Tests are all writing, unreasonable amount of time for the midterm. Don't skip tutorials or you risk failing. Don't take this if you don't like symbolism and deeply interpreting things.

His humour was the only half-decent part about this course. I completely agree w/ whoever said that Jaws was ruined b/c of the analysis. TAs and tutorials were completely useless and half of the movies were brutal to watch (I slept thru most of them).  Exams are not very easy. Definitely would not do another FPA course.

Chris is one of the greatest profs I have ever had the luck to take a class with. I took this for an elective, and had no idea what I was getting into, but his lectures are always interesting and entertaining. I will definitely take a class with him again.

a really nice guy. good prof, but not a great one. one reason: it's kinda hard to hear him in lecture cos he doesn't use mic, and his voice can be quite soft. other than that, i'd say it's fun to take his class.

Meh, class was ok. I was taking this class for PDP admissions. Some of the films were interesting but I ended up sleeping through a couple of them. Ruined Jaws for me with the anaylsis (...the shark actually was symbol of the repressed black man, give me a break). Readings are tough and extremely boring. Midterm was ok and tutorials alright.
Very funny, knowledgable prof. If you're a film buff, you should deffinitely take his class
